data.title: one overnite with breakfast
data.text: front desk very nice and helpful, nice room, relatively quiet, but we did hear train whistle at night.....excellent buffet breakfast---cereals, eggs, sausage, pancakes, yogurt, waffles, coffee and juice....... good parking

data.title: Friendly staff and very good for the price
data.text: I would return here again anytime I am in the area. All the staff was very friendly and the service was very good. The breakfast in the morning, which was included on weekdays, is very well done. Stayed on the second floor and it appears some repairs to the ceiling in the hallway are being done. The room was clean, bed comfortable, but did show some mild wear, typical of a hotel room that is not new, not a deal breaker at all. Make sure you use the hotel web site only to get the breakfast and local shuttle service included, thank you Betty for letting me know this, as part of the rate. Their best rate was by far the best I could find on any website. This is not a chain hotel, just a local good find.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: We stayed here for 3 nights and were exceptionally pleased. For an older hotel, it had been refurbished; our room was specious and clean, very comfortable bed. A full-servicel bar and restaurant in the lobby area where you can purchase drinks and snacks or a great dinner meal. The staff was very friendly. The location - unbeatable.

data.title: No guarantees at the Norwalk Inn
data.text: I arrived at the property to claim my reservation for an upgraded room that was in the guest house for a two night stay for an out-of-town wedding. I was told that It would "love" it and it was described to me as roomy one bedroom with a king sized bed, seperate sitting area with a couch and kitchen facilities. I explained I needed a king bed and was assured it would be no problem. At the front desk I was told I had been switched to "the apartment".  After viewing the apartment and seeing that the bed was a queen and there was no couch or all that much room in the smallish third floor room, I was told that they do not guarantee accommodations in the Guest House. The price however, did not change. When I called on day two to have the room made up and the trash emptied, I was told they don't do that in the guest house. I paid double the price of a standard room for less service. We were considering eating in the restaurant but it was extremely hot so we asked if the air could be put on but we were told they were trying to save money on the electricity! It had to be over 80 In that room with no other customers in sight. The front desk people passed us several times and ignored us, did not make eye contact or even smile. Hardly warm and friendly!  We were there for the wedding but wished we picked a different hotel.

data.title: Convenient, Pleasant, Good time
data.text:
The Norwalk Inn is a good value, convenient to area attractions such as the Maritime Aquarium, Sono, and trains to New York City.  A car is needed, or cabs and Uber are available.

The pool is really nice, the breakfasts are good, and the Inn has had extensive renovation.  Hope you like your visit!

data.title: delightful
data.text: We decided to have our family reunion at the Norwalk Inn. From the moment we walked into the building we knew it would be perfect. Every staff member from the front desk to the dining room and maintenance staff were courteous and helpful in  every way.  Lisa and Chris were such gracious hosts. Family members traveled in from all around the US and all were so happy we chose this venue.  There was not one detail that was overlooked throughout the  weekend. We had a list of special requests and each and every one was handled with no "hassle" and they were very sensitive to accommodating these requests. Thank you to the Norwalk Inn for making this special weekend so perfect!

data.title: Renovation
data.text:
Stayed on the 2nd floor. The inn looks like it is undergoing extensive repairs both inside and outside. It was clean and staff very friendly. The king-sized bed was very comfortable. The room also had a small frig and keurig for a coffee lovers convenience. The wifi was free throughout the inn but need to change servers depending on your location.
The only downfall in my opinion is the outside pool is only open from Memorial day to Labor day as we visited in October.

data.title: Fitness center
data.text: I usually stay at the Norwalk Inn about 3 times a year. We have meetings in the conference room. Free breakfast is included. Nice selection eggs, sausage, potatoes etc. The room are always clean an affordable. My room was a bit dated but OK. The really only disappointment is the fitness center. It seems like an afterthought. One elliptical machine was out of order. The other that worked, that I used the keypad could not key inn any of the options. Also they don't provide wipes to clean off the machines cor before or after use.

data.title: Perfect for the area
data.text:
Stayed one night, but it was a great find in that area, Even for a weekday the place was busy with people at the bar.
Room was nice- clean, new, smelled fine. A bit small, but for a place to stay I don't need 900 sq feet. But all in all it was great, A lot quieter than I expected as well.  Staff were very nice and friendly.
Would recommend and stay there again. Price was very good.

data.title: Fine overnight stay
data.text:
My husband and I stayed at the Norwalk Inn for one night so we could attend a family funeral.  We had a Standard/King Bed room.  It was a bit compact, but everything we needed was there, including a refrigerator and Keurig coffee maker.  We found everything very clean and presentable.  I guess what most affected us was how soft the bed was -- we would have preferred a firmer mattress, but it seems the "soft" type is what one finds most often in hotels these days.  The linens were very nice.  The room was quiet and we were not disturbed in any way.  

We received a friendly welcome at the front desk when we checked in.  We did not eat at the in-house restaurant, but grabbed breakfast at a nearby diner instead ("Peggy's").  There is some construction going on at the hotel but it did not affect us overnight.  We would be happy to stay at the Norwalk Inn again and would recommend it to others.  Be aware, if you need a little more room, perhaps for a longer stay, you might be more comfortable in the next-size-larger room, but the Standard room was perfectly adequate for us.

data.title: Currently under construction but a great value
data.text: They are currently adding a third floor to this property, and there are many changes still to come, but they currently offer a great value and we were glad we stayed there.  The breakfast buffet was included in the price of the room.

data.title: Overpriced and not well maintained
data.text: I was given a 'suite' which is a large room.  The window was located in the corner so there was no natural light coming into the room.  The bathroom had mold on the ceiling and the wall paper was peeling off.  The tub did not drain well.  This room is tired and needs repair.   The ceiling in the hallway looked like it was being patched.  Overall not a good deal for the money.

data.title: Norwalk Inn
data.text:
Average room, bathroom.
My room did have a fridge which was very nice and they provided complimentary bottled water each day.
Pool looked very nice.
I was there as part of a business conference. They provided nice meals for the group (breakfast and lunch). I could only locate one ladies room which was an issue for a conference for mainly women and the bathroom had some type of issue on day 2 of the conference (flooding in bathroom).

data.title: Clean, centrally location
data.text: Everybody at this Hotel was helpful. The rooms comfortable, beds insured a good nigths sleep and an outdoor pool. The buffet breakfast offered if you book directly through the Hotel was excellent. The price very reasonable

data.title: family reunion
data.text: we  had our family reunion here. hospitality was great! rooms were really nice. location is good. nice pool. nice restaurant. nice Bar.  very clean!! room service was very good. they have a Keurig coffee maker in the room and a fridge. they give you an assortment of coffee. beds were super comfortable.

data.title: Stayed here for a wedding
data.text: We booked this hotel bc we had a wedding event here. The lady at the front desk was super nice and professional when we checked in. We were given a room on the second floor and the hotel is going through renovation the roof on the hallways was all patched up and the elevator was also covered up due to the construction? Although our room was nice and everything looked brand new the construction took away from their 4 star rating. Also, one bartenders there was rude but not nearly as rude as the older lady at the front desk when we checked out, she never smiled , never made eye contact. I'm sure once the construction is over the hotel will be great as for the staff, they must strive to provide the upmost respect and good customer service as this is a 3/4 star hotel!

data.title: Quiet location,  convenient to I-95
data.text:
We stayed here for a friend's wedding in June.  Our room was on the small side, but we were rarely in it.  
It was a wonderful site for a large wedding.  Great patio area for cocktails and hors d'oeuvres, and thankfully the weather was perfect.  Bartenders were efficient and made sure the line kept moving.
The ballroom for the reception was large and had room for a very adequate dance space.  Nice lighting effects.
There is a full service restaurant on-site with free breakfast Mon-Fri.  
Check-in and out easy.

data.title: I expected more after reading other reviews
data.text:
We stayed here for an overnight trip to the aquarium and beach with our 3 kids and were sadly disappointed in the room and breakfast.   I read the reviews about this place and expected more than what we got.   The staff was pleasant and check in was quick and easy.   Decor is nice but it goes down hill from there.   Walking to our room the halls are stuffy and humid.   The room with 2 queen beds was small and the beds were terrible!   You sink to the floor when you sit down on the edge and the few pillows on the bed were not comfortable at all either.  Even our kids couldn't sleep,  and kids sleep anywhere!   The bathroom was missing parts,  like the bottom cover of the sink faucet,  and no exhaust fan and wires hanging for a TV I presume.   An air duct was in the bathroom but was obviously inoperable since there was tons of dust built up on it and hanging off the grate.  
We were given 2 free breakfasts at the buffet breakfast in the restaurant at the hotel.   We checked it out and after seeing that there  was hardly any food out and what was there was terrible we just had the kids eat pancakes and we left.   Usually my kids we will eat 4 or 5 pancakes,  they each had 1 and said they were done.   Probaly because I needed a steak knife to cut them.  I expected there to be the basic breakfast food available and refilled quickly when we were there at 8 am for breakfast.   At $11.95 a person,  this is again not what I expected.   
It's a shame,  the staff seemed very nice and helpful,  but the rooms and breakfast  (or lack there of) soured our stay here.  Sadly  I would not recommended this place.

data.title: A Vacation Home Experience
data.text:
Most recently, we had the pleasure of staying at the Guest House at Norwalk Inn in a One Bedroom Suite. It is by far the best property we’ve had the pleasure of staying at in our many visits to Norwalk. 

Upon entering the suite we noticed the sheer historic value. Then to add all the comforts of having a full kitchen, dishwasher, cabinets with plates and pots and pans, a dining room, and a large living room with comfortable seating and wall mounted flat screen TV made this a property that we could stay at indefinitely. The unite had all the comforts of home and could easily pass as a personal vacation home.

The location of the property made it very easy to visit Connecticut and New York. In fact there is a short cut nearby that allows you to bypass some street traffic entering the Merritt Parkway. It also wasn’t too far from countless restaurants and Interstate 95 where you’ll find a near direct shot to the beaches.

The highlight of the room was certainly the bathroom. The bathroom was appointed with a standup shower with a floor to ceiling glass enclosure, and beautiful accented walls. 

The bathroom featured what I considered to be one of the most comfortable showers I’ve had the pleasure of using. After running around in the hot and humid outdoors of CT beaches, the relaxing shower was essential. The rain-shower head gave you the feeling of visiting a spa. 

Overall, the Guest House and Norwalk Inn is a wonderful, one-of-a-kind property.

data.title: Beautiful Historic Inn
data.text: The hotel is situated in a great location. Away from the crowds but conveniently close to the Historic Area where City Hall is and Downtown SoNo which adds to the non-cookie cutter feel. We will definitely choose staying here next time we visit Norwalk.
